title-group.article-title: On the Ideology of Metaphor in Pereda's "Peñas arriba"

Jakobson's classic distinction between metaphor and metonymy as the respective root figures of romantic and realist discourse remains useful in this sense (76-82)

Ricoeur demonstrated in what remains one of the most comprehensive philosophical approaches to metaphor, the substitutionary model of the trope, based on a rhetoric that takes the word as its unit of reference, predominated throughout the nineteenth century (4-64)

Peñas arriba engages in what Fredric Jameson, following Northrup Frye, has identified as the hallmark gesture of romance: "[It] does not in- volve the substitution of some more ideal realm for ordinary reality [...] but rather a process of transforming ordinary reality" (110)
